summary: Context Architecture is a consulting business founded in 2025 that helps individuals and SMBs structure their knowledge so AI tools can use it effectively, solving what founder CJ Mitchell calls the Midas Problem where AI lacks context about users' true needs. The company's competitive advantage lies in its methodology for structuring domain-specific knowledge into queryable systems, positioning the knowledge layer as the defensible moat while voice AI becomes commoditized.
products_services: Foundation tier: discovery sessions, ontology design, knowledge graph creation, MCP integration
Voice Layer tier: custom voice persona creation, real-time voice interfaces
Digital Twin tier: personality capture, expertise preservation
context-engine: open source CLI tool for text to structured JSON pipeline

key_people.name: CJ Mitchell
key_people.context: Founded Context Architecture in Atlanta Georgia in 2025

customers.target: individuals and small to medium businesses
segments: law firms losing institutional knowledge when senior partners retire
financial advisory practices needing voice AI with client portfolio knowledge
healthcare practices wanting AI that understands patient history
real estate brokerages needing property knowledge systems

competitive_position: Methodology-focused differentiation with the process of structuring domain-specific knowledge into queryable systems as the defensible moat, while underlying AI models and voice layers are commoditized
key_facts: Solves the Midas Problem: AI gives exactly what you asked for but not what you meant due to lack of context
Revenue model is project-based consulting with recurring maintenance contracts
Founding thesis: voice layer is commoditizing but knowledge layer is the moat
First product is context-engine, an open source CLI tool
